G.T.6161
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 1st NOVEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front. In FLANDERS to French continued the operations begun yesterday east of COURTRAI and are reported to have reached the line of the SCHELDT from LECKE to the junction with the British. AUDENARDE is still held by the enemy.
The line reached by the British attack this morning south of VALENCIENNES is as follows :- east of MARESCHES, crossroads 1,000 yards south-east of PRESEAU, PRESEAU (doubtful, road from PRESEAU to MARLY as far as the railway line, thence along the railway to the south of VALENCIENNES.
Sixteen hundred prisoners were taken.
French Front. The French Fourth Army attacked this morning on the AISNE between RILLY-AUX-OIES and OLIZY and have made progress averaging over one kilometre.
In the ARGONNE the First American Army also attacked this morning west of the MEUSE and the following line is reported to have been reached :- CHAMPIGNEULLE, IMECOURT, south of CHENIRY, south of REMONVILLE, south of the BOIS D'ANDEVAINNE, AINCREVILLE (doubtful).
ITALIAN FRONT.
Troops of the Third Italian Army have reached the LIVENZA at MOTTA DI LIVENZA and TORRE DI MOSTO. Further west advanced troops have overcome the enemy rear-guards in the Pass of ST. BULDO and are descending into the PIAVE valley towards BELLUNO.
BALKAN AND PALESTINE FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
1st November 1918.
Issued at 18.50
